result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonia L Rudie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Straight-Time. 
-Sentence credit of 1 day is granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: -Any other sentence the defendant may be serving.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be refunded to poster. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
-No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

-Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent. 
-No contact with any Walmart Store in Waukesha County. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonia L Rudie

records.addlTxt: to the Court filed by the Department of Corrections requesting a review of the Judgment of Conviction. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - Court will amend the JOC to 1 year of probation**
End of representation letter filed by Atty. Tapia.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:47 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonia L Rudie in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Antonia L Rudie.  Court notes a plea questionnaire as been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Defense and State advise they are prepared to proceed today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Tapia confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Tapia.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:  
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
9 Months Jail Straight Time (IF imposed 1 Day Credit and Consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be on at the time).  

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with any Walmart store in Waukesha County.
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription
-	No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $ 253.00 (includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Court to apply the $500.00 Cash Bail on deposit; any remaining bail to be refunded to the Poster. Failure to pay; will result in a civil judgment.
Character letter filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:46 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Antonia L Rudie in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Tapia provides an update, he is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing. Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:42 AM Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonia L Rudie in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:35 PM Defendant Antonia L Rudie in court with attorney Andrew Herbers for attorney Ricardo Tapia.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ricardo Tapia appointed counsel by Public Defender's Office
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:21 AM Defendant Antonia L Rudie in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
